subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Hi
msgSnippet: Well, I m not too up on unicode but I d be glad to help. It seems to me that we d need a 48 glpyh mapping. 40 for the main letters, 2 for the letters loch and
messageBody:
Well, I'm not too up on unicode but I'd be glad to help.

It seems to me that we'd need a 48 glpyh mapping.
40 for the main letters, 2 for the letters loch and llan (is that
correct? the scan is difficult to read) and 1 for the naming dot.
That'd leave 4 glyphs free, I'd use two of them for the angled
parenthesis (they look neat).

You'd also need a 4 letter script code, 'Quik' is still free according
to unicode.org.

Have you tried the ConScript registry?
It'd be a good place to test the mapping and work out any 'bugs'.

Found the fonts - they all seem to work well.
I've translated some of the texts on my computer and am trying to read
them back without referring to the originals too often.

Paige Gabhart wrote:
> Welcome to the group.
>
> The unicode mapping hasn't gotten off the ground yet. I would like to
> get this moving, but it seems like everyone is too busy.
> If you know anything about this, we would welcome all the help we can
> get. You can install a font so that you can use QS on your computer.
>
> Paige
>
>
> amd64_hacker wrote:
>
> >Hi,
> >
> >I'm learning quikscript and I thought I would join your group.
> >
> >I'm really interested in switching my computer to use quikscript
> >natively, I see there is work on a unicode mapping how is that going?
> >
> >(btw - Hi jennifferjen glad to see another new member :-)
